com.yantra.api.inv

Interface updateInventoryCost

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface updateInventoryCost

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document updateInventoryCost(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The updateInventoryCost API is used to update the inventory value of an item at a given ship node.

    • Method Detail

      • updateInventoryCost

        org.w3c.dom.Document updateInventoryCost(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        The updateInventoryCost API is used to update the inventory value of an item at a given ship node. This should be used whenever the Accounts Payable application generates a variance between expected PO cost and the actual cost on the Payables Invoice. The variance amount should be passed back to Sterling system to be reflected in the inventory value. The Sterling system will try to adjust the inventory value and re-compute the average cost. Should the total on-hand be less than the purchase quantity(due to subsequent shipments or issues), the total variance will be pro-rated and applied to the remaining on-hand inventory.An additional event will be raised to adjust the difference in the financial system.

        The InventoryValue and AverageCost is evaluated based on two conditions:

        1) When ONHAND inventory is greater than input Quantity:
        InventoryValue = (Old InventoryValue) + (Input InventoryValue)
        AverageCost = InventoryValue / (ONHAND Quantity)

        2) When ONHAND quantity is less than the input Quantity:
        InventoryValue = (Old InventoryValue) + (Input InventoryValue * (ONHAND quantity / (Input Quantity)))
        AverageCost = InventoryValue / (Input Quantity)

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:

        Following events are raised under transaction INVENTORY_COST_UPDATE
        COULD_NOT_APPLY_INV_VALUE_CHANGE:

        • If the total on-hand is less than what has to be adjusted, total variance will be prorated and applied on the remaining on-hand inventory.
        • The amount not applied on Sterling system will be passed back to the financial application by raising this event that publishes the variance amount details.

        Data published - YFS_UPDATE_INVENTORY_COST.COULD_NOT_APPLY_INV_VALUE_CHANGE
        Key data - YFS_UPDATE_INVENTORY_COST.COULD_NOT_APPLY_INV_VALUE_CHANGE

      Audits: None

      Pre-conditions: None

      Post-conditions: None

      Output Template Support: Yes

      Database Extensibility Support: N/A

      Additional Information:
      API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains the updated Inventory cost information. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
